competencyText.en-us: Grade 6-8
General
Identify and explore careers in the Marketing, Sales & Service cluster.
Identify the pathways in the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster and the careers in each pathway.
Describe the types of places that employ individuals who have careers in the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster.
Describe the variety of tasks performed by individuals who have careers in the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster.
List the skills, abilities, and talents needed for careers in the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster.
Identify the level of training and education required for careers in the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster.
Research a career in the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster and present findings to the class.
Apply math, science, and reading skills in the completion of a project or activity related to the Marketing, Sales & Service career cluster.
Identify general marketing activities.
Explain the role of marketing in the economy.
Identify and define selected marketing terms.
Identify the major marketing activities.
Identify career opportunities available in marketing.
Identify career opportunities which involve selling.
Identify career opportunities which involve purchasing.
Identify career opportunities which involve promotion.
Identify career opportunities which involve risk management.
Identify career opportunities which involve pricing.
Identify career opportunities which involve finance.
Identify career opportunities which involve marketing information management.
Identify career opportunities which involve product and service planning.
Identify career opportunities which involve distribution.
Identify career opportunities at the entry, career sustaining, specialist, and manager and entrepreneur level for marketing.
Identify employment requirements for marketing careers.
Identify employment requirements in the area of selling.
Identify employment requirements in the area of purchasing.
Identify employment requirements in the area of promotion.
Identify employment requirements in the area of risk management.
Identify employment requirements in the area of pricing.
Identify employment requirements in the area of finance.
Identify employment requirements in the area of marketing information management.
Identify employment requirements in the area of product and service planning.
Identify employment requirements in the area of distribution.
Identify employment requirements at the entry, career sustaining, specialist, and manager and entrepreneur level for marketing.
Identify programs instrumental in developing career choices.

Identify senior high school marketing education programs available to students who desire a career in marketing (e.g., fashion marketing, travel and tourism, finance, entrepreneurship, international marketing).
Identify post-secondary education opportunities in marketing (e.g., real estate, insurance, hospitality, customer service, travel).
Identify human relations skills that will enable students to succeed in their career goals.
Identify acceptable grooming and health habits.
State the importance of dependability and responsible behavior.
State the importance of a positive attitude.
State the importance of getting along with co-workers, employers, and other business associates.
Identify advantages of Distributive Education Clubs of America (DECA) and Collegiate DECA, associations of marketing students.
Identify DECA and Collegiate DECA and the role of each organization in marketing education.
Identify the purposes of DECA and Collegiate DECA.
Identify the advantages of student involvement in DECA and Collegiate DECA.
Identify the leadership opportunities available through DECA and Collegiate DECA.
Identify the competitive event opportunities available through DECA and Collegiate DECA.
Identify local DECA and Collegiate DECA chapters.
Identify foundational skills required in marketing careers.
Identify economic skills used in marketing.
Identify marketing, business, and entrepreneurship skills used in marketing.
Identify communication and interpersonal skills used in marketing.
Identify professional development skills used in marketing.
Identify human resource skills used in marketing.
Identify computer skills used in marketing.
Identify the functions of marketing.
Identify the role of risk management.
Identify the role of selling.
Identify the role of promotion.
Identify the role of pricing.
Identify the role of purchasing.
Identify the role of marketing information management.
Identify the role of product and service management.
Identify the role of distribution.
Identify the role of finance.
Identify the basic economic environment in marketing.
Explain private enterprise.
Explain profit motive.
Identify the relationships between people's wants and needs and marketing activities.
Identify the education needed, tasks performed, and employment opportunities for individuals who wish to enter marketing services occupations.
Identify marketing services occupations (e.g. food service, hospitality, travel and tourism, finance, international marketing, insurance, real estate, entrepreneurship).
Identify the basic tasks performed by employees within each of the occupations.
Identify employment opportunities available for each of the occupations.
State the educational requirements to prepare students for entry-level employment in marketing services occupations.
Identify educational programs available in the state for advanced training in specific occupations related to marketing services in secondary through postsecondary education.
Identify procedures involved in choosing, applying for, keeping and progressing in marketing occupations.
Identify the tasks involved in choosing a marketing occupation (self-inventory, interest survey, research, aptitude test batteries).
List the steps in applying for a job, including the aspects of online job searches.
Complete a sample job application form using digital apps.
Demonstrate the necessary communication skills involved in online, virtual or video conferences, and in-person interviews.
Identify those characteristics that help people obtain, hold, and progress in marketing-related occupations (e.g. digital citizenship, personal branding, and social media etiquette).
Develop an individual career plan including a four to six year plan for advanced training in a marketing career.
Use appropriate social media sites and online portfolios.
Explain the impact of technology on marketing occupations.
Explain how technology, including interactive social media and video storytelling strategies, has changed the way retail businesses operate.
Explain how technology, including interactive social media and video storytelling strategies, has changed the way wholesale businesses operate.
Explain how technology, including interactive social media and video storytelling strategies, has changed the way product merchandising businesses operate.
Explain how technology, including interactive social media and video storytelling strategies, has changed the way marketing services businesses operate.
Develop individualized education and career plans related to marketing occupational goals.
Complete self-assessments and career analysis activities to determine potential success in marketing career fields.
Research a marketing-related career; identify employment opportunities and educational requirements for advancement.
Project the career level and earnings required to obtain a desired standard of living.
Utilize career information to develop an individualized career plan; include a plan to meet educational requirements.
Demonstrate an understanding of the e-marketing career pathway.
Define and use the terminology associated with the e-marketing career pathway.
Describe careers available in the e-marketing career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of careers in the e-marketing career pathway.
Research the history of the e-marketing career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the e-marketing career pathway.
Describe technologies associated with careers in the e-marketing career pathway.
Merchandising
Demonstrate an understanding of the buying and merchandising career pathway.
Define and use terminology associated with the buying and merchandising career pathway.
Describe careers available in the buying and merchandising career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of careers in the buying and merchandising career pathway.
Research the history of the buying and merchandising career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the buying and merchandising career pathway.
Describe technologies associated with careers in the buying and merchandising career pathway.
Identify the education needed, tasks performed, and employment opportunities for individuals who wish to enter occupations related to product merchandising and the online marketplace.
Identify product merchandising related occupations (e.g., fashion, retailing, food marketing, home furnishings, sporting goods, parts marketing, specialty products, wholesaling, business ownership).
Identify the basic tasks performed by employees within each of the occupations.
Identify employment opportunities available in each of the occupations.
State the educational requirements to prepare a student for entry-level employment in occupations related to product merchandising.
Identify educational programs available in the state for advanced training in occupations related to product merchandising in secondary through postsecondary education.
Identify the education needed, tasks performed, and employment opportunities for individuals who wish to enter wholesaling occupations.
Identify wholesaling occupations.
Identify the basic tasks performed by employees within each of the occupations.
Identify employment opportunities available for each of the occupations.
State the educational requirements to prepare a student for entry-level employment in wholesaling occupations.
Identify educational programs available in the state for advanced training in occupations related to wholesaling in secondary through postsecondary education.

Demonstrate an understanding of the marketing communications and promotion career pathway.
Define and use terminology associated with the marketing communications and promotion career pathway.
Describe careers available in the marketing communications and promotion career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of careers in the marketing communications and promotion career pathway.
Research the history of the marketing communications and promotion career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the marketing communications and promotion career pathway.
Describe technologies associated with careers in the marketing communications and promotion career pathway.

Research the history of the management and entrepreneurship career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the management and entrepreneurship career pathway.
Describe technologies associated with careers in the management and entrepreneurship career pathway.

Define and use terminology associated with the distribution and logistics career pathway.
Describe careers available in the distribution and logistics career pathway.

Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the distribution and logistics career pathway.
Describe technologies associated with careers in the distribution and logistics career pathway.
Marketing Research
Demonstrate an understanding of the marketing information management and research career pathway.
Define and use terminology associated with the marketing information management and research career pathway.
Describe careers available in the marketing information management and research career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of careers in the marketing information management and research career pathway.
Research the history of the marketing information management and research career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the marketing information management and research career pathway.
Describe technologies associated with careers in the marketing information management and research career pathway.
Professional Sales
Demonstrate an understanding of the professional sales and marketing career pathway.
Define and use terminology associated with the professional sales and marketing career pathway.
Describe careers available in the professional sales and marketing career pathway.
Identify common characteristics of careers in the professional sales and marketing career pathway.
Research the history of the professional sales and marketing career pathway and describe how the associated careers have evolved and impacted society.
Identify skills required to successfully enter any career in the professional sales and marketing career pathway.
